grossApy.tooltip-1: The expected interest earned by Lenders on an annualised basis, prior to Kasu protocol fees being deducted, assuming all repayments will be made as expected. This does not account for the additional APY earned from compound interest, which accrues every Epoch (every seven days).
grossApy.tooltip-2: Kasu protocol fees comprise 10% of interest earned by Lenders. For example, if the Gross APY is stated as 15%, then the Net APY earned by Lenders is 13.50% after 1.50% is deducted for fees (i.e. 10% x 15% = 1.5%).​
grossApy.tooltip-3: Half of this fee is to fund Protocol Fee Sharing for Lenders who are also KSU Token Lockers. The remaining half of this fee is retained by the Kasu protocol to fund operations.
grossApy.tooltip-4: In the event of losses, Senior Tranche Lenders have the first claim on any recovered funds, followed by Mezzanine (if applicable) and Junior Tranche Lenders.

variableAndFixedApy.tooltip-1: The expected interest earned by Lenders on an annualised basis, prior to Kasu protocol fees being deducted, assuming all repayments will be made as expected. This does not account for the additional APY earned from compound interest, which accrues every Epoch (every seven days).
variableAndFixedApy.tooltip-2: A variable APY will be subject to change every {{ epoch }} epochs.
variableAndFixedApy.tooltip-3: ​A fixed APY will be locked for the specified period of time. ​During a fixed APY period, no Withdrawal Requests can be submitted.
variableAndFixedApy.tooltip-4: Kasu protocol fees comprise 10% of interest earned by Lenders. For example, if the Gross APY is stated as 15%, then the Net APY earned by Lenders is 13.50% after 1.50% is deducted for fees (i.e. 10% x 15% = 1.5%).​
variableAndFixedApy.tooltip-5: Half of this fee is to fund Protocol Fee Sharing for Lenders who are also KSU Token Lockers. The remaining half of this fee is retained by the Kasu protocol to fund operations.​
variableAndFixedApy.tooltip-6: In the event of losses, Senior Tranche Lenders have the first claim on any recovered funds, followed by Mezzanine (if applicable) and Junior Tranche Lenders​

weightedAverageApy.tooltip-1: The average gross APY (prior to Kasu protocol fees being deducted) you are currently earning within this Lending Strategy that has been adjusted to reflect your weighted contribution to each Tranche relative to your total contribution across all Tranches (assuming all repayment will be made as expected). In the absence of multiple Tranches, this simply reflects the gross APY for the Single Loan Offer within this Lending Strategy
weightedAverageApy.tooltip-2: This does not account for the additional APY earned from compound interest, which accrues every Epoch (every seven days).
weightedAverageApy.tooltip-3: Kasu protocol fees comprise 10% of interest earned by Lenders. For example, if the Gross APY is stated as 15%, then the Net APY earned by Lenders is 13.50% after 1.50% is deducted for fees (i.e. 10% x 15% = 1.5%).​
weightedAverageApy.tooltip-4: ​Half of this fee is to fund Protocol Fee Sharing for Lenders who are also KSU Token Lockers. The remaining half of this fee is retained by the Kasu protocol to fund operations.​

lifetimeInterestEarned.tooltip-1: The total combined amount of interest you have earned (after fees) from all tranches within this Lending Strategy (or Single Loan Offer in the absence of multiple Tranches) since you first started lending to this Lending Strategy. To view a breakdown of your total historical interest earned across all Lending Strategies, please visit the 'My Portfolio' tab.​
lifetimeInterestEarned.tooltip-2: Kasu protocol fees comprise 10% of interest earned by Lenders. For example, if the Gross APY is stated as 15%, then the Net APY earned by Lenders is 13.50% after 1.50% is deducted for fees (i.e. 10% x 15% = 1.5%).​
lifetimeInterestEarned.tooltip-3: Half of this fee is to fund Protocol Fee Sharing for Lenders who are also KSU Token Lockers. The remaining half of this fee is retained by the Kasu protocol to fund operations.​

apyStructure.tooltip-1: Indicates whether the APY(s) offered by the Delegate to Lenders is fixed for a specified period of time, or variable, or a mixture of both.
apyStructure.tooltip-2: A variable APY will be subject to change every 4 epochs.
apyStructure.tooltip-3: A fixed APY will be locked for the specified period of time. During a fixed APY period, no Withdrawal Requests can be submitted.

overview.title: Your Funds
overview.metric-1-tooltip: KSU balance currently held in your Web3 wallet, including the current estimated USDC equivalent.
overview.metric-2-tooltip: Total USDC equivalent value of all tokens in your Web3 wallet that can be used to purchase KSU tokens.
overview.metric-3-tooltip: Your balance of KSU currently locked.

rksuBalance.tooltip: The value of your current rKSU balance, which is derived by a multiplier applied to your amount of locked KSU. This multiplier varies according to your locking period, per the below table. The value of your rKSU balance relative to your total current and pending USDC deposits across all Lending Strategies determines your Loyalty Level. Your Loyalty Level determines the extent of your token utility (lending strategy deposit priority and withdrawal priority) and associated rewards (APY bonus). Regardless of your Loyalty Level, your rKSU balance relative to the total rKSU in the Kasu ecosystem, also determines your share of Protocol Fees.

loyalty.title: Loyalty Status
loyalty.description: Regardless of your Loyalty Level, you are entitled to Protocol Fee Sharing based on the balance of your rKSU relative to all rKSU in the Kasu ecosystem.
loyalty.metric-1-tooltip: The value of your current rKSU balance, which is derived by a multiplier applied to your amount of locked KSU. This multiplier varies according to your locking period, per the below table. Regardless of your Loyalty Level, your rKSU balance relative to the total rKSU in the Kasu ecosystem, also determines your share of Protocol Fees.
loyalty.metric-2-toolip: For the purposes of calculating your Loyalty Level, your total lending includes your existing lending plus your pending lending.

level-0.title: No Loyalty Status
level-0.description-1: There is no requirement to purchase and lock KSU to lend on Kasu. However, you will be ranked behind Loyalty Level 1 and 2 Lenders for access to Lending Strategies, your desired loan tranches and capital withdrawals. You will also not be eligible for bonus APY.​
level-0.description-2: However, if you lend USDC and lock KSU, but have not generated enough rKSU to achieve a Loyalty Level, you will still be entitled to Protocol Fee Sharing. This is based on the balance of your rKSU relative to all rKSU in the Kasu ecosystem.

level-1.description-2: Regardless of your Loyalty Level, you are entitled to Protocol Fee Sharing based on the balance of your rKSU relative to all rKSU in the Kasu ecosystem.

level-2.title: Loyalty Level 2

rewardsSummary.title: KSU Bonuses & Rewards
rewardsSummary.metric-1-tooltip: Your share of USDC Protocol Fees earned that is available to claim. A Token Locker must also participate in USDC lending and generate rKSU to be eligible for Protocol Fee Sharing. Token Lockers, who are also Lenders generating rKSU, are entitled to a share of 5% of the total gross interest earnings generated by lending activities on Kasu. Your proportionate share of this amount is determined by your rKSU balance relative to the total combined rKSU balances generated by all Lenders in the Kasu ecosystem. For example, in a scenario where a total of 1,000 rKSU from Lenders exists in the entire Kasu ecosystem, a Lender with a current balance of 150 rKSU (which is 15%) would be entitled to 15% of all Protocol Fees. This proportionality is augmented as more Lenders lock (or unlock) KSU to generate more rKSU (or burn more rKSU when unlocking), entitling them to a proportionate share of Protocol Fees.
rewardsSummary.metric-2-toolip-1: The value of your KSU balance (and estimated USDC equivalent value) associated with the following bonuses/rewards (per Rewards 1 and 2 below):
rewardsSummary.metric-2-toolip-2: 1) APY Bonus (only applicable to Loyalty Level 1 and 2 KSU Token Lockers); and,
rewardsSummary.metric-2-toolip-3: 2) KSU Launch Bonus (only applicable for early Token Lockers until the KSU bonus pool (5% of total supply) is fully consumed, which is based on the amount and duration of KSU locked and the associated multiplier).

Loyalty Level 2 Token Lockers receive a higher APY bonus than Loyalty Level 1. The APY bonus is variable and will change from time to time to meet liquidity demand and supply requirements.​ There are no fees deducted from your APY bonus.​ There are no fees deducted from your APY bonus.

rewards-1.metric-3-tooltip: The total amount of APY bonus interest your have received since the very first time you achieved (and maintained) Loyalty Level 1 or 2.

loyaltyLevels.title: KSU Loyalty Program​
loyaltyLevels.subtitle: About KSU Loyalty Program
loyaltyLevels.description-1: The more you lock, the higher your Loyalty Level and the more utility and rewards you receive.
loyaltyLevels.description-2: If you do not wish to lock KSU tokens, then you can still participate in lending to earn interest. However, you will not receive any APY Bonus, and your Lending and Withdrawal Requests will be prioritised behind Loyalty Level 1 and 2 Token Lockers.
loyaltyLevels.description-3: Should you unlock any amount of KSU, your rKSU will be burned in relative proportion. This may adversely affect your Loyalty Level, which in turn, adversely affects your access to Lending Strategies and loan Tranches, along with your position in the queue for withdrawals from your existing lending. It may also affect your APY bonus. It will also reduce your share of Protocol Fees, regardless of Loyalty Level.

riskWarning.title: Risk Warning
riskWarning.description: All lending carries risk. Different Lending Strategies may also carry different levels of risk. Some of the risks of lending on Kasu are as follows:

subheader-1.title: General Risks
subheader-1.description-1: Prospective Lenders should understand that all lending carries varying degrees of risk, including the potential for loss of some or all of a Lender’s income and/or capital, a less than expected interest rate return (APY), and delays in End Borrower repayments and Lender Withdrawals. When considering a Lending opportunity, it is important to consider such things as:
subheader-1.description-2: It is generally considered that opportunities offering potentially higher returns (APY) also carry a higher level of risk. Lenders should seek their own independent financial advice before lending on Kasu.

list.list-0: The risks involved in Lending in a particular Lending Strategy;
list.list-1: The extent that the Lending Strategy fits your financial objectives and goals; and

subheader-2.title: Income and Capital Risks
subheader-2.description-1: Risks attaching to Lending on Kasu include (but are not limited to):
subheader-2.description-2: The degree of income and capital risk associated with Lending on Kasu relate to the financial performance of Delegates and their End Borrower customers, to which your funds are on-lent. This will be affected by factors including End Borrowers’ ability to repay their Loans and Delegates’ competence in credit diligence, credit risk structuring and risk management.
subheader-2.description-3: Neither Kasu, nor any of its directors, employees and contractors, nor any other related company or Delegates, guarantee the performance of the loans or the repayment of loaned capital. Loans on Kasu are subject to credit (and other) risks. This could involve delays in repayment of Loans, loss of some or all of interest returns and capital, and interest returns that fluctuate.

list.list-0: You may not receive the interest return you expected; and/or,
list.list-1: You may lose some or all of your capital.

subheader-3.title: Performance and Default Risk
subheader-3.description: Your lending balance can increase based on interest earned, and it can decrease based on any losses and defaults caused by End Borrowers. Interest earnings are not guaranteed, and you may lose money. Interest rates (APY) vary, so future interest returns may differ from past interest returns.

subheader-4.title: Market Risk
subheader-4.description: Changes in financial markets, interest rate markets, the economy, political changes, technological developments, global or local-specific events and changes in market sentiment continually affect the risk of lending. These market risks can affect End Borrowers’ ability to repay loans, which in turn, may cause defaults and losses.

subheader-5.title: Interest Rate Risk
subheader-5.description: Changes in interest rates can directly and indirectly affect your lending balance and interest returns. For example, an increase in official interest rates may result in increased default risk to End Borrowers, affecting their ability to repay loans, which in turn, may cause defaults and losses.

subheader-6.title: Credit Risk
subheader-6.description-1: Credit risk is the risk that the Underlying Borrowers (End Borrowers) may not meet their obligations in full and not pay interest and repay capital or other financial obligations on time. In the case that this results in losses, the balance of your lending may reduce. Examples of credit risk include where the End Borrower is a business and becomes insolvent or under external administration, or a guarantor is an individual and becomes bankrupt or dies.
subheader-6.description-2: All lending to Kasu is completely unsecured, which increases risk compared with secured lending. Kasu on-lends Lenders’ funds to Delegates, who on-lend to End Borrowers. There is no direct security taken by Lenders over Kasu or Delegates. Delegates seek to reduce credit risk by taking security over End Borrowers for the benefit of Lenders. Delegates also provide choice of loans across a range of End Borrowers, industries and geographic sectors. Delegates employ a range of risk management strategies and credit structuring to reduce credit risk where possible.

subheader-7.title: Delegate Counterparty Risk
subheader-7.description: Kasu does not guarantee the performance of Delegates and their End Borrower customers. All credit due diligence, credit underwriting and credit risk management related to End Borrowers is undertaken by Delegates. Kasu accepts no responsibility for any losses. This includes the potential failure and credit risk of a Delegate.

subheader-8.title: Protocol Risks
subheader-8.description: The Kasu protocol could terminate. Fees could increase. There is no guarantee that the Lending Strategies offered on Kasu will perform successfully and as intended.

subheader-9.title: Smart Contract Risk
subheader-9.description: As with any RWA (real world asset) lending protocol, bugs or errors in the code, as well as malicious actors exploiting vulnerabilities, could lead to unexpected or incorrect results and financial losses to Lenders. Smart Contracts on Kasu have undergone audits to address such potential risks; however there is no guarantee that audits are or will be successful in identifying errors in the code and Lenders use the protocol at their own risk.

subheader-10.title: End Borrower Concentration Risk
subheader-10.description: Lending Strategies may be subject to some degree of concentration risk, being the risk associated with Delegates that may only on-lend to a limited number of End Borrowers, thus increasing the risk if an End Borrower fails to repay its loan.

subheader-11.title: Tranche Risk
subheader-11.description: In the event of any end borrower defaults, Senior Tranche Lenders are paid first from any recovered funds, but this still depends on the overall recovery rate. In the event that less than 100% is recovered, losses are proportionately applied across Lenders in the lowest ranking tranche first (Junior Tranche), proceeding up the line through Mezzanine Tranche (if applicable) and finally to Senior Tranche. This proportionality is applied in line with the abovementioned ranking order, regardless of which individual end borrower(s) a particular Lender’s funds are loaned to (i.e.any losses borne by the Lending Strategy are mutualised across Lenders starting from the lowest ranking tranche).In the absence of Junior and Mezzanine Tranches, losses are proportionately applied across all Lenders in the single available tranche.

subheader-12.title: Currency Exchange Risk
subheader-12.description: Cryptocurrency-Fiat Exchange Rate Risk: Lenders deploy USDC (or a cryptocurrency that is swapped to USDC via 1inch), which Delegates convert to fiat currency to originate business loans to End Borrowers. Given that not all fiat loans will be denominated in US Dollars (e.g.. AUD, GBP and CAD), currency exchange rate risk may be evident. Similarly, Delegates convert fiat currency to USDC to meet Withdrawal Requests from Lenders, which similarly carries currency risk. Where deemed appropriate, Delegates may use currency hedging instruments to mitigate such risks.

subheader-13.title: Political, Legal and Regulatory Risks
subheader-13.description: The regulatory environment for cryptocurrencies is still evolving. New regulations or changes in existing laws can impact the operation of RWA lending platforms (and DeFi in general),  potentially leading to closures, additional compliance requirements, unanticipated expenses or other challenges that could affect Lenders and End Borrowers. As above, it is important for users to understand and manage these and other risks before participating in activities on the Kasu protocol. Kasu has engaged a Tier 1 global legal firm to seek advice around the regulatory environment in which Kasu operates.

subheader-14.title: Liquidity (Withdrawal) Risk
subheader-14.description: This arises when there is insufficient liquidity in a strategy to facilitate smooth withdrawals, which may result in Lenders being unable to withdraw funds as and when required.

subheader-15.title: Cyber (Data Security and Electronic Delivery) Risk
subheader-15.description: Because your lending on Kasu is on the blockchain and fully online, which relies on computers, information technology (IT) networks and the internet, it is subject to inherent IT risks including (but not limited to) software and smart contract bugs, computer viruses and malware, unauthorised interference with data, loss of data, unavailability or unreliability of the internet, computer malfunction, network vulnerabilities, latency, and cyber hacking resulting in the theft of data. The online Kasu platform may be unavailable from time to time. You will need to consider the potential for disruption or other difficulties when planning to use Kasu and the dApp.

subheader-16.title: No Guarantee
subheader-16.description: None of Kasu and its related entities, officers or personnel, or Delegates on Kasu, guarantee the performance of your loans, or the repayment of any loan amount, or the interest returns. Lending on Kasu is entirely at the risk of Lenders. No one and no entity makes any representation as to the success or otherwise of your lending on Kasu.

subheader-17.title: KSU Token Price Risk
subheader-17.description: The KSU token is subject to price volatility. If you lock KSU to avail of the token’s utility and benefits, negative price fluctuations in the token may negate some, or all, of these benefits and may even fluctuate to the point where you may be in a less favourable overall position than if you didn’t purchase and lock KSU to achieve utility and benefits.

subheader-18.title: Delegate Concentration and KSU Token Price Risk
subheader-18.description: At the current point in time, Apxium is the only Delegate Kasu has partnered with. This not only presents concentration risk in the event that the Delegate and/or its End Borrower clients fail, but also presents risk to KSU token holders. For example, if Apxium ceased participating as a Delegate on Kasu, then the KSU token may no longer have utility, which in turn, may affect the KSU token price significantly.

termsAndConditions.title: Important Information
termsAndConditions.subtitle: By submitting this lending request, you acknowledge and agree to the following Important Information. It is important to read and understand these terms, as they outline the rights, responsibilities, and risks associated with your participation in the Kasu protocol.

subheader-1.title: Important Information
subheader-1.description-1: This is a summary of some key information  for Lenders on the Kasu protocol. It is important to read and understand this Important Information, as it summarises some of the important rights, responsibilities, and risks associated with lending using the Kasu protocol.
subheader-1.description-2: However it is important to note that this Important Information is a summary only and does not contain all the risks and features associated with Lending through Kasu. In addition to reading and understanding this Important Information, prospective Lenders should also read and understand the:
subheader-1.description-3: The Loan Contract will be presented in the next steps of your Lending Request.

subheader-2.title: Risk Disclosure: Senior, Mezzanine and Junior Tranches
subheader-2.description: When lending through Kasu, it is essential to understand the different types of lending Tranches that may be made available—Senior, Mezzanine, and Junior—and the different risks associated with each Tranche. Each Tranche has a distinct risk profile and position in the capital structure, which affects the potential returns and the risk to Lenders’ capital.

sub-subheader-1.title: Senior Tranche
sub-subheader-1.description: The Senior Tranche is the highest-ranking Tranche. In the event of losses, Senior Tranche Lenders have the first claim on any recovered funds.

list-0.title: Lower Yield:
list-0.description: Due to its highest ranking priority in repayment in the event of losses, the Senior Tranche typically offers lower interest rates compared to Mezzanine and Junior Tranches.

list-1.title: Credit Risk:
list-1.description: In the event of any end borrower defaults, Senior Tranche Lenders are paid first from any recovered funds, but this still depends on the overall recovery rate. In the event that less than 100% is recovered, losses are proportionately applied across Lenders in the lowest ranking Tranche first (Junior Tranche), proceeding up the line through Mezzanine Tranche (if applicable) and finally to Senior Tranche. This proportionality is applied in line with the abovementioned ranking order, regardless of which individual end borrower(s) a particular Lender’s funds are loaned to (i.e.any losses borne by the Lending Strategy are mutualised across Lenders starting from the lowest ranking Tranche).In the absence of Junior and Mezzanine Tranches, losses are proportionately applied across all Lenders in the single available Tranche.

sub-subheader-2.title: Mezzanine Tranche
sub-subheader-2.description: The Mezzanine Tranche sits between the Senior and Junior Tranches. It generally offers higher returns (interest rate) than the Senior Tranche but comes with increased risk.

list-0.title: Subordination Risk in Event of Losses:
list-0.description: Mezzanine Lenders are subordinated to Senior Tranche Lenders in the event of losses. This means that in the event of losses, they are repaid only after all Senior Tranche obligations have been met.

list-1.title: Credit Risk:
list-1.description: There is a higher risk of non-payment (capital risk) compared to the Senior Tranche. In a default scenario, Mezzanine Lenders may experience significant delays in repayment and an increased risk of capital loss (compared to Senior Tranche Lenders). In such an event, after Senior Tranche Lenders have been repaid in full, if there is not enough recovered to pay all Mezzanine Tranche Lenders in full, losses are proportionately mutualised across all Lenders in the Mezzanine Tranche, regardless of which individual end borrower(s) a particular Lender’s funds are loaned to. Similarly, recoveries (if any), after Senior Tranche Lenders have been repaid in full, are proportionately applied across all Lenders in the Mezzanine Tranche, regardless of which individual end borrower(s) a particular Lender’s funds are loaned to. Only after Senior Tranche and Mezzanine Tranche Lenders have been repaid in full are any remaining recoveries allocated to the repayment of Junior Tranche Lenders (see below).

sub-subheader-3.title: Junior Tranche
sub-subheader-3.description: The Junior Tranche is the lowest-ranking Tranche. It generally offers the highest potential returns (interest rate) but also bears the greatest risk.

list-0.title: Subordination Risk in Event of Losses:
list-0.description: Junior Tranche Lenders are the last to be paid in the event of losses. They only receive repayments after all obligations to Senior and Mezzanine Lenders have been fulfilled.

list-1.title: Credit Risk:
list-1.description: The risk of capital loss is highest in the Junior Tranche. In a loss scenario, Junior Tranche Lenders may experience significant delays in repayment and the greatest risk of capital loss (compared to Senior Tranche and Mezzanine Tranche Lenders). In such an event, after Senior Tranche Lenders and Mezzanine Tranche Lenders have been repaid in full, if there is not enough recovered to pay all Junior Tranche Lenders in full, losses are proportionately mutualised across all Lenders in the Junior Tranche, regardless of which individual end borrower(s) a particular Lender’s funds are loaned to. Similarly, recoveries (if any), after Senior Tranche Lenders and Mezzanine Tranche Lenders have been repaid in full, are proportionately applied across all Lenders in the Junior Tranche, regardless of which individual end borrower(s) a particular Lender’s funds are loaned to.

list.list-3: In the event that a Lending Strategy commences with Senior and Junior Tranches only, but a Mezzanine Tranche is subsequently added, the Junior Tranche Lenders will move from a second ranking position (second to the Senior Tranche) to a third ranking position (ranking behind both Senior and Mezzanine Tranches).

sub-subheader-4.title: Acknowledgment of Risks
sub-subheader-4.description: By lending in a particular Tranche, Lenders acknowledge and accept the inherent risks associated with their chosen position in terms of priority in the event of losses and recoveries. It is crucial for Lenders to thoroughly assess their risk tolerance, lending objectives, and financial situation before committing capital to any Tranche.

subheader-3.title: Fees Explanation and Gross APY Disclosure
subheader-3.description-2: All advertised APY rates are presented on a gross basis (before fees). This means that the actual APY received by Lenders will be net of the protocol fees outlined below.
subheader-3.description-4: All fees taken by the Kasu protocol are derived from the interest generated by lending activities. A percentage of this interest is allocated to various components of the ecosystem to support its ongoing development and maintenance.
subheader-3.description-6: For example, if a Lending Strategy offers an advertised 20% APY to Lenders, the associated fees are as follows:
subheader-3.description-7: In this scenario, a Lender who participates in a Lending Strategy advertised with a 20% APY (gross) will receive 18% APY (net) after the deduction of fees.

list-0.title: Protocol Fee Sharing:
list-0.description: 5% of the total interest earned by Lenders is allocated towards Protocol Fee Sharing.

list-1.title: Kasu Protocol Wallet:
list-1.description: 5% of the total interest earned by Lenders is allocated to the Kasu Protocol wallet.

list-2.list-0: 1% APY (5% of 20% APY) is allocated towards Protocol Fee Sharing.
list-2.list-1: 1% APY (5% of 20% APY) goes to the Kasu Protocol wallet.

subheader-4.title: Interest Accrual
subheader-4.description: Interest on loaned capital is accrued on a “per epoch” basis (an epoch being every 7 days) and added to each Lender's loan balance (commonly referred to as capitalised interest). Accessing accrued interest occurs through the same mechanisms as accessing the initial loaned capital, requiring Lenders to submit a withdrawal request.
subheader-4.subtitle: Acknowledgment of Interest Accrual Process
subheader-4.subtitle-description: By lending through Kasu, Lenders acknowledge and accept the interest accrual process. It is essential for Lenders to understand that interest is accrued on a per epoch basis and reflected in their loan balance (i.e. capitalised interest). Access to these funds requires a withdrawal request, which applies to both the initial loaned capital and the accrued interest, thereby reflective of a Lender’s total balance.

subheader-5.title: Pending Phase Before Interest Accrual
subheader-5.description: When Lenders submit a Lending Request to Kasu, their funds enter a Pending Phase until the next Clearing Period. The Clearing Period occurs at the end of an epoch, during which Lending Requests and Loan Withdrawal Requests are processed.
subheader-5.subtitle: Acknowledgment of Pending Phase and Clearing Period Process
subheader-5.subtitle-description: By lending through Kasu, Lenders acknowledge and accept the Pending Phase and Clearing Period process. It is crucial for Lenders to understand that their funds will only start accruing interest once their Lending Request is accepted at the end of the Clearing Period. Lenders also acknowledge that in rare circumstances, a Clearing Period could be missed, resulting in their Lending Request being processed in a future epoch.

list-0.title: Pending Phase:
list-0.description: Funds do not start accruing interest immediately upon the submission of a Lending Request. They remain in a Pending Phase until the next Clearing Period, which occurs at the end of each epoch.

list-1.title: Clearing Period:
list-1.description: At the end of each epoch, during the Clearing Period, Lending Requests and Loan Withdrawal Requests are processed. Based on factors such as each Lender's Loyalty Level and the liquidity needs of each Lending Strategy, funds are either accepted or rejected.

list-2.title: Start of Interest Accrual:
list-2.description: If funds from a Lending Request are accepted during a Clearing Period (end of an epoch), the Lender will then start accruing interest from the beginning of the next epoch.

list-3.title: Clearing Period Delays:
list-3.description: There is a risk that a Clearing Period could be missed, causing the Lending Request to be processed at a future epoch.

subheader-6.title: Loan Withdrawal Requests
subheader-6.description: When Lenders submit a Loan Withdrawal Request to Kasu, their request enters a Pending Phase (queued). Acceptance of these Loan Withdrawal Requests is evaluated during each Clearing Period (end of each epoch) and is contingent upon the excess liquidity within the specific Lending Strategy, and may therefore remain outstanding (or partially outstanding) for one or more epochs. Excess liquidity is based on various factors outside of Kasu and Delegates’ control, such as (but not limited to) demand for Lending Strategies and End Borrowers meeting repayment requirements.
subheader-6.subtitle: Acknowledgment of Loan Withdrawal Request Process
subheader-6.subtitle-description: By submitting a Loan Withdrawal Request through Kasu, Lenders acknowledge and accept the Pending Phase and the process based on excess liquidity. Lenders understand that:

list-0.title: Pending Phase and Excess Liquidity:
list-0.description: Loan Withdrawal Requests remain in Pending Phase (queued) until they are accepted as part of each Clearing Period (end of each epoch), which is dependent on the excess funds available within the given Lending Strategy. This means that Lenders may only withdraw funds up to the excess liquidity available, potentially resulting in partially fulfilled (or even unfulfilled) Withdrawal Requests until the next Clearing Period.

list-1.title: Multiple Epochs:
list-1.description: Withdrawal Requests may therefore remain outstanding/queued (or partially outstanding/queued) for more than one epoch until sufficient liquidity is available, which will be determined during each Clearing Period (end of each epoch).

list-2.title: Priority Based on Loyalty Level:
list-2.description: Withdrawal Requests are prioritised according to each Lender's Loyalty Level, with higher Loyalty Levels receiving preference. Lenders with lower or no Loyalty Levels may experience longer waiting times for their Withdrawal Requests to be accepted.

list-3.title: Automatic Loyalty Level Increase:
list-3.description: Any Withdrawal Request left outstanding for more than five epochs will automatically be prioritised above all Loyalty Levels until the withdrawal is accepted.

list-4.title: Interest Accrual:
list-4.description: Interest continues to accrue during the Pending Phase until the Withdrawal Request is accepted. Upon the successful processing of a Withdrawal Request, the withdrawing Lender's lending position stops accruing interest.

list-5.title: Losses:
list-5.description: should a loss occur within a Lender’s selected Lending Strategy whilst a Lender’s Withdrawal Request is in Pending Phase (queued), the loss(es) will adversely impact the Lender’s loan and potentially the ability for the Lender to be repaid in whole or in part.

list-1.list-0: Access to their funds is contingent upon the availability of excess liquidity within the Lending Strategy, which is determined during each Clearing Period (end of each epoch). Excess liquidity is based on various factors outside of Kasu and Delegates’ control, such as (but not limited to) demand for Lending Strategies and End Borrowers meeting repayment requirements.
list-1.list-1: Withdrawal Requests are prioritised based on Loyalty Level, potentially resulting in longer waiting times for lower or no Loyalty Level Lenders.
list-1.list-2: Withdrawal Requests may therefore remain outstanding (or partially outstanding) for more than one epoch until sufficient liquidity is available.
list-1.list-3: Any Withdrawal Request that has been outstanding for more than five epochs will automatically receive the highest Loyalty Level until the withdrawal is processed.
list-1.list-4: Interest continues to accrue during the Pending Phase and stops only upon the successful acceptance of a Withdrawal Request.
list-1.list-5: Funds that remain in Pending Phase (queued) will still be affected by losses within Lending Strategies, given that the WIthdrawal Request is yet to be accepted.

subheader-7.title: Tranche Allocation and Overflow in Case of Oversubscription
subheader-7.description: When Lenders submit a Lending Request for a specific Tranche through Kasu, it’s possible that the requested Tranche could be oversubscribed. In such cases, the following process is applied:
subheader-7.description-1: An example is given by the following Lending Strategy with three Tranches:
subheader-7.description-2: In this scenario, the excess 50,000 USDC from the Junior Tranche will be reallocated to the Mezzanine Tranche. Once the Mezzanine Tranche is filled, the remaining 40,000 USDC will be reallocated to the Senior Tranche. This results in:
subheader-7.description-3: This scenario leaves 30,000 USDC of the initial requests unallocated, which will be returned to the Lenders who submitted those requests.
subheader-7.subtitle: Acknowledgment of Tranche Allocation and Overflow Process
subheader-7.subtitle-description: By lending through Kasu, Lenders acknowledge and accept the Tranche allocation and overflow process in case of oversubscription. Lenders understand that:

list-0.title: Oversubscription Handling:
list-0.description: If a requested Tranche (e.g., Junior) is oversubscribed, the excess funds are automatically reallocated to the next higher-ranking Tranche available with capacity (e.g., Mezzanine or Senior).

list-1.title: Continual Reallocation:
list-1.description: This reallocation continues up the line until all available Tranches are filled.

list-2.title: APY Impact:
list-2.description: Next available Tranches will have a lower APY (interest return), but will be higher ranking in terms of repayment priority in the event of losses (see ‘Risk Disclosure: Senior, Mezzanine and Junior Tranches’ Section).

list-3.title: No Opt-Out:
list-3.description: Lenders cannot opt-out of this reallocation process once their Lending Request is submitted. If they are not satisfied with their participation in a lower-yielding Tranche, they may either ‘opt-out’ within 48 hours of being informed by Kasu of the end borrower(s) to which their funds will be loaned, or they must submit a Loan Withdrawal Request as outlined earlier.

list-4.title: Potential Return of Funds:
list-4.description: If the reallocation process reaches the Senior Tranche and it is still oversubscribed, any remaining unallocated funds will be returned to the Lenders who submitted those requests.

list-0.title: Priority Allocation:
list-0.description: Higher Loyalty Levels increase the likelihood of allocation to the desired Tranche but do not guarantee it.

list-3.list-0: Their Lending Requests may be reallocated to higher-ranking/lower-yielding Tranches if the requested Tranche is oversubscribed.
list-3.list-1: The lower-yielding Tranche will have higher ranking in terms of repayment priority in the event of losses (see ‘Risk Disclosure: Senior, Mezzanine and Junior Tranches’ Section).
list-3.list-2: Higher Loyalty Levels increase but do not guarantee priority allocation to the desired Tranche.
list-3.list-3: Reallocation is automated. If Lenders are not satisfied with their participation in a lower-yielding Tranche, they may either ‘opt-out’ within 48 hours of being informed by Kasu of the end borrower(s) to which their funds will be loaned, or they must submit a Loan Withdrawal Request as outlined earlier.
list-3.list-4: Any unallocated funds at the end of the reallocation process will be returned to the Lenders that have been rejected if the Senior Tranche is still oversubscribed.

subheader-8.title: Automated Opt-In
subheader-8.subtitle: Acknowledgment of Automated Opt-In
subheader-8.subtitle-description: By lending through Kasu, Lenders acknowledge and accept that if they do not select Opt-out within the 48 hour timeframe of being informed of the identity of the end borrower(s) to which their funds will be loaned, their funds will be automatically deployed. At that point, funds can only be returned via the normal Withdrawal Request process.
subheader-8.description-1: Once a Lending Request is accepted, the Delegate has 30 days to identify an end borrower to which a Lender’s funds will be deployed. Once the Delegate identifies a suitable end borrower(s), the Lender is informed via email of the identity of the end borrower(s) to which their funds will be loaned.
subheader-8.description-2: The Lender is offered the following choices:
subheader-8.description-3: Lenders are able to select Opt-in or Opt-out requests via the
subheader-8.description-4: in the Kasu dApp once their wallet is connected.
subheader-8.description-5: The above process repeats each time a Lender’s funds are deployed to another end borrower(s).
subheader-8.description-6: It is each Lender's responsibility to ensure their email spam filters are adjusted to accept emails from the address:
subheader-8.description-7: Kasu accepts no responsibility for any emails that have been missed.

list-0.title: Opt-out:
list-0.description: the Lender has 48 hours to opt out from the lending, in which case, their funds will be returned; or,

list-1.title: Instant Opt-in:
list-1.description: the Lender may opt in immediately (prior to the end of the 48 hour period); or,

list-2.title: Automated Opt-in:
list-2.description: if the Lender provides no instruction within the 48 hour period, they are deemed to have automatically opted in (otherwise known as ‘negative consent’).

subheader-9.title: Fixed APY Loans - Withdrawal Restrictions & Other Conditions
subheader-9.description: Loans with a fixed APY are fixed for the loan term made available to, and selected by, Lenders. During the fixed term, Lenders are unable to submit Withdrawal Requests. However, Lenders can request their funds be fully returned upon the expiry of the fixed term period by providing notice prior to the four epochs leading up to the fixed loan expiry date. Should a lender not provide such notice, their loan will automatically convert to the prevailing variable APY, and Lenders will be subjected to the normal Withdrawal Request process.
subheader-9.subtitle: Acknowledgment of Fixed APY Withdrawal Restrictions & Other Conditions
subheader-9.subtitle-description: By lending through Kasu, Lenders acknowledge and accept the restrictions and other conditions associated with fixed APY loans. Lenders understand that:

list-0.title: Fixed Loan Term and Fixed APY:
list-0.description: the period which the APY is fixed for is the same period the loan term is fixed.

list-1.title: No Withdrawal Requests:
list-1.description: no Withdraw Requests can be made during the fixed term period.

list-2.title: Notice Period for Return of Funds:
list-2.description: Lenders can request their funds be fully returned upon the expiry of the fixed term period, without having to undergo the normal Withdrawal Request process and the associated queueing system; however Lenders must notify Kasu prior to the four epochs leading up to the fixed term expiry date by following the notification process outlined on the Kasu platform (see ‘My Portfolio’ by the ‘My Lending Portfolio’ section on the Kasu platform).

list-3.title: No Notice Provided for Return of Funds:
list-3.description: should a Lender not provide notice as required, their loan will automatically convert to the prevailing variable APY, and which will be subjected to the normal Withdrawal Request process.

If you are also a Lender, this may adversely affect your Loyalty Level, which in turn, adversely affects your access and withdrawal priority to and from loans, along with your APY bonus. It will also reduce your share of Protocol Fees, regardless of Loyalty Level. The value of your rKSU balance relative to your total current and pending USDC lending across all Lending Strategies determines your Loyalty Level. Your Loyalty Level determines the extent of your token utility (lending access priority and lending withdrawal priority to and from Lending Strategies) and associated rewards (APY bonus). Regardless of your Loyalty Level, your rKSU balance, relative to the total combined rKSU balance of all Lenders in the Kasu ecosystem, also determines your share of Protocol Fees.

list-4.title: Application of Loan Amount
list-4.description: Kasu will transfer the Loan Amount, less Charges, to Apxium to make available to the End Borrower. The Lender’s rights are limited to Kasu under this Loan Agreement, and contingent on:

list-4-1-list.title: Apxium’s and the End Borrower’s actions as set out in clause 6.2; and

list-4-2-list.title: the priority and tranche specified in the Business Lending Opportunity.

list-5-1-list.title: Withdrawal Notice
list-5-1-list.description: If the Lender wishes withdraw from this Agreement, or withdraw a part of its Loan Amount, it must submit a withdrawal notice to the Borrower (Withdrawal Notice). The Withdrawal Notice must specify the amount to be withdrawn and comply with any other requirements outlined by the Borrower in the Business Lending Opportunity on the Kasu Platform.

list-5-2-list.title: Contingent Repayment of Withdrawn Amounts
list-5-2-list.description: Upon receipt of a valid Withdrawal Notice, the Borrower:

list-5-2-list-0.list-0: shall repay the Loan, or any lesser amount specified in the Withdrawal Notice, to the Lender within 90 calendar days;

list-1.title: the Borrower’s obligations under 6.2.1 are contingent upon:

list-5-2-list-0-list-1-list.list-0: the End Borrower repaying the sum of the Loan to Apxium, and Apxium repaying that amount to Kasu within that time period; and
list-5-2-list-0-list-1-list.list-1: in the priority of their Loyalty Status set out in clause 6.3 below.

list-2.title: If a lesser amount than the full Loan is repaid to Kasu, then Kasu will:

list-5-2-list-0-list-2-list.list-0: repay this sum to the Borrower in partial satisfaction of the Loan, subject to the priority set out in clause 6.3 below; and
list-5-2-list-0-list-2-list.list-1: Kasu, acting reasonably, will provide the Borrower with an Amendment Notice.

list-5-3-list-0.title: The Loyalty Status of a Lender is determined by the criteria set forth in Schedule 1 of this Agreement.

list-5-3-list-1.title: Where multiple Lenders lend to a Business Lending Opportunity, Lenders with higher Loyalty Status shall receive priority in the repayment of their withdrawn amounts over Lenders with lower Loyalty Status.

list-5-3-list-2.title: If multiple Lenders within the same Loyalty Status submit Withdrawal Notices, repayment amounts, if less than the total Loan, will be distributed pro-rata as between them and together with an Amendment Notice.

list-6-1-list.title: Each party represents and warrants to the other that:

list-0.title: it has full power and authority to enter into and do all things under this Agreement;

list-1.title: that they have taken independent legal and financial advice on this Agreement; and

list-6-1-list-0-list-2-list.list-0: they are not in the business of providing credit as defined by the NCCP;
list-6-1-list-0-list-2-list.list-1: the economic value of the Loan Amount is set at the date of the Deployment Date at the prevailing conversion rate to AUD;
list-6-1-list-0-list-2-list.list-2: that they are wholly responsible for the safeguarding of tokens provided to them in connection with this Agreement; and
list-6-1-list-0-list-2-list.list-3: that their assignment of the token, and entry into this Agreement, is legally permitted in their jurisdiction.

list-7-1-list-0.list-0: keep the terms of this Agreement confidential, and must not disclose the details of it;
list-7-1-list-0.list-1: not disclose any information that identifies an End Borrower, as obtained in connection with this Loan Agreement;
list-7-1-list-0.list-2: take all steps reasonably necessary to maintain the confidentiality of any information that identifies an End Borrower, including to secure such information against theft, loss or unauthorised disclosure.

list-7-2-list.title: Acceptance
list-7-2-list.description: The acceptance of the Borrower’s request, and entry into this Contingent Loan Agreement, will be taken to have occurred when the Lender purchases a Token.

list-7-3-list.title: Assignment
list-7-3-list.description: This Agreement is binding on the parties and neither party must assign this Agreement or any of its rights or obligations under this Agreement.

list-7-4-list.title: Governing law and jurisdiction
list-7-4-list.description: This agreement takes effect, is governed by, and will be construed in accordance with the laws from time to time in force in the State of South Australia, Australia. The parties submit to the non-exclusive jurisdiction of the courts of the State of South Australia, Australia.

subheader-4-1.title: Loyalty Level 1
subheader-4-1.description: If the value of a Lender’s rKSU balance, relative to their total current and pending USDC lending (including USDC lending requests that are yet to be cleared) across all Business Lending Opportunities is 1% or greater, but less than 5%, then the Lender will achieve Loyalty Level 1. This entitles the Lender to the following utility and benefits:

list.list-0: Second order priority access to Business Lending Opportunities available on Kasu (including loan Tranches within each Business Lending Opportunity) in the case that they are oversubscribed (behind Loyalty Level 2).
list.list-1: Second order priority for capital withdrawals (i.e. when a withdrawal request is made) from existing Lending (behind Loyalty Level 2).
list.list-2: Additional interest earnings (bonus interest) awarding the Lender with bonus interest earnings on all their lending on Kasu, awarded in KSU tokens (subject to change according to liquidity demand and supply requirements).

subheader-4-2.title: Loyalty Level 2
subheader-4-2.description: If the value of a Lender’s rKSU balance, relative to their total current USDC lending (including USDC lending requests that are yet to be cleared) across all Business Lending Opportunities is 5% or greater, then the Lender will achieve Loyalty Level 2. This entitles the lender to the following utility and benefits:

list.list-0: First order priority access to Business Lending Opportunities available on Kasu (including loan Tranches within each Business Lending Opportunity) in the case that they are oversubscribed.
list.list-1: First order priority for capital withdrawals (i.e. when a withdrawal request is made) from existing lending.
list.list-2: Additional interest earnings (bonus interest) awarding the Lender with higher bonus interest earnings than Loyalty Level 1 on all their lending on Kasu, awarded in KSU tokens (subject to change according to liquidity demand and supply requirements).

subheader-4-3.title: No Loyalty Level
subheader-4-3.description: Lenders who do not also purchase the KSU token and lock it for a minimum period (outlined below) to derive rKSU and achieve a Loyalty Level, do not achieve the above utility/benefits.

subheader-4-4.title: Derive rKSU to Achieve a Loyalty Level
subheader-4-4.description: Lenders must lock KSU to derive rKSU. The amount of rKSU a Lender can derive is based on a multiplier applied to the amount of locked KSU.

list.list-0: This multiplier varies according to the locking period, per the below table.
list.list-1: The value of a Lender’s rKSU balance relative to their total current and pending USDC lending across all Business Lending Opportunities determines the Loyalty Level (outlined above).
list.list-2: Your Loyalty Level determines the extent of a Lender’s token utility/benefits (outlined above).

deposit.amount-metric-2: Minimum KSU Lock amount to achieve Loyalty Level 2

description.metric-1: By depositing funds to this Lending Strategy, you accept the following
description.metric-4: IF THIS TRANCHE IS OVERSUBSCRIBED, YOU WILL BE AUTOMATICALLY REALLOCATED TO THE NEXT AVAILABLE TRANCHE WITH A LOWER APY WITHOUT THE OPPORTUNITY TO OPT OUT. YOU WILL THEN BE SUBJECT TO QUEUING SYSTEM SHOULD YOU WISH TO WITHDRAW YOUR FUNDS.
description.metric-5: YOU WILL BE SUBJECT TO A QUEUING SYSTEM SHOULD YOU WISH TO WITHDRAW YOUR FUNDS FROM ANY TRANCHE. YOU CAN ACHIEVE WITHDRAWAL PRIORITY IN THE QUEUE BY LOCKING KSU TO ESTABLISH /INCREASE YOUR LOYALTY LEVEL​.
description.metric-6: How do I secure my spot in this tranche?
description.metric-7: Access to higher APY tranches is based on Loyalty Level. In the event of oversubscription, applicants will be automatically reassigned to the next available tranche. This process repeats for each tranche. Higher Loyalty Levels increase the likelihood of allocation to the desired tranche, but do not guarantee it.

duration.title: Locking Duration
duration.unlocking-date: The date that your locked KSU will become unlocked, based on the locking duration simulation your have chosen via the above slider.

estimates.title: Estimated Bonuses & Rewards
estimates.tooltip-1-1: Your projected USDC Protocol Fees. This is based on your simulated KSU locking amount and duration, and the project amount of rKSU this is expected to be generated per the rKSU multiplier displayed in the above slider.
estimates.tooltip-1-2: A Token Locker must also participate in USDC lending and generate rKSU to be eligible for Protocol Fee Sharing. Token Lockers, who are also Lenders generating rKSU, are entitled to a share of 5% of the total gross interest earnings generated by lending activities on Kasu. Your proportionate share of this amount is determined by your rKSU balance relative to the total combined rKSU balance of all Lenders in the Kasu ecosystem. For example, in a scenario where a total of 1,000 rKSU from Lenders exists in the entire Kasu ecosystem, a Lender with a current balance of 150 rKSU (which is 15%) would be entitled to 15% of all Protocol Fees. This proportionality is augmented as more Lenders lock (or unlock) KSU to generate more rKSU (or burn more rKSU when unlocking), entitling them to a proportionate share of Protocol Fees.
estimates.tooltip-2: Your projected APY bonus interest (paid in KSU) in addition to the APY associated with your lending balances, which is only applicable to Loyalty Level 1 and 2 KSU Token Lockers. Loyalty Level 2 Token Lockers receive a higher APY bonus than Loyalty Level 1. The APY bonus is variable and will change from time to meet liquidity demand and supply requirements.
estimates.tooltip-3: Your projected KSU Launch Bonus for being an early Token Locker, based on the amount and duration of KSU locked and the associated multiplier as follows:

Loyalty Level 2 Token Lockers receive a higher APY bonus than Loyalty Level 1. The APY bonus is variable and will change from time to meet liquidity demand and supply requirements.

earningsCalculator.slippage-tooltip: Swapping your cryptocurrency to USDC will be executed via 1inch, which may incur slippage of up to 1%. Slippage refers to the difference between the expected price of a trade and the actual executed price of the trade. It typically occurs in markets experiencing high volatility, low liquidity and network congestion. For example, assume you wish buy 50 USDC for 400 DOGE (which is the same as 'swapping' 400 DOGE for 50 USDC). But, due to sudden market volatility, the actual executed price ends up being 404 DOGE. In this case, the slippage is 4 DOGE, or 1% of the intended trade amount. The maximum amount of slippage tolerance for this trade is set at 1%

poolOverview.title: Lending Strategy Overview
poolOverview.subtitle: Loan Overview

apyStructure.label: APY Structure
apyStructure.tooltip: Indicates whether the APY offered by the Delegate to Lenders is fixed for a specified period of time, or variable.​ A variable APY will be subject to change every 4 epochs.

fixedApyExpiry.label: Fixed APY Expiry Date
fixedApyExpiry.tooltip: The date that the fixed APY expires and reverts to a Variable APY, or a new fixed APY.

assetClass.label: Asset Class
assetClass.tooltip: The lending specialisation, type or category adopted by the Delegate for this Lending Strategy.

industry.label: Industry Exposure
industry.tooltip: Industry and/or business category in which the Delegate's customers (end borrowers) operate.

security.label: Security
security.tooltip: The form of collateral or commitment provided by the Delegate's customers (end borrowers) to secure their loans, so that in the event of default, the Delegate has recourse to recover the debt.

lendingHistory.label: Lending History
lendingHistory.tooltip: Total length of time the Delegate has been operating as a lending business.

loansUnder.label: Total Active Lending
loansUnder.tooltip: Total USDC equivalent face value of all outstanding loans that the Delegate currently has deployed to end borrowers from this Lending Strategy.​

tvl.label: Total Value Locked (TVL)
tvl.tooltip: Total USDC funds deployed by Lenders to this Lending Strategy, plus first loss capital (if contributed by the Delegate).

terms.label: Term & Structure
terms.tooltip: ​The term and structure offered to Lenders, which typically matches the requirements of this Lending Strategy to suit the lending asset class and loan structure provided to end borrowers. Open Ended means that the Lending Strategy is ongoing with no defined end date upon which Lenders will be repaid. This is because the Lending Strategy facilitates Revolving Loans to end borrowers, which also have no defined end date. Such loans are typically utilised to fund ongoing operations (akin to a Line of Credit, Working Capital Loan or Evergreen Facility). Lenders must therefore submit withdrawal requests to access any capital return. Term Loan means that there is a defined end date upon which Lenders will be fully repaid. This may, or may not, also include scheduled principal repayments throughout the term of the loan. Whilst repayment(s) occur without the need to submit withdrawal requests, the repayment profile is pre-defined, with little to no flexibility to submit ad-hoc withdrawal requests. This is because Term Loans are typically used to fund longer duration assets, such as  capital expenditure or long term projects (such as property).

totalPoolYieldEarnings.label: Total Interest Earned
totalPoolYieldEarnings.tooltip: Cumulative total gross interest earned by Lenders from this Lending Strategy since its inception on the Kasu protocol, prior to Kasu protocol fees being deducted.​

totalLossRate.label: Total Loss Rate
totalLossRate.tooltip: ​Total unrecoverable losses expressed as a percentage of total loans associated with this Lending Strategy.

trancheCard.minDeposit-tooltip: The minimum Lending Request amount the Delegate will accept from a single Lender​
trancheCard.maxDeposit-tooltip: The maximum Lending Request amount the Delegate will accept from a single Lender​

remainingCapacity.label: Remaining Capacity
remainingCapacity.tooltip: Amount of additional USDC funds the Delegate can accept within this Lending Strategy, also represented as a percentage of the maximum Lending Strategy target amount.​

investmentCard.title: Your Lending
investmentCard.tooltip: The Annual Percentage Yield currently offered by the Delegate for this Lending Strategy, assuming all repayments will be made as expected.

totalAmount.label: Total Lending Balance
totalAmount.tooltip: Your combined total USDC lending balance across all Tranches (or single Lending Strategy offer in the absence of multiple Tranches) within this Lending Strategy.

weightedAvgApy.label: Weighted Average Gross APY
weightedAvgApy.tooltip: The average gross APY (before fees) you are currently earning within this Lending Strategy that has been adjusted to reflect your weighted contribution to each Tranche relative to your total contribution across all Tranches. In the absence of multiple Tranches, this simply reflects the gross APY for this Lending Strategy (assuming all repayment will be made as expected).​

totYieldEarned.label: Total Lifetime Interest Earned
totYieldEarned.tooltip: The total combined amount of interest you have earned (after fees) from all tranches within this Lending Strategy (or single Lending Strategy offer in the absence of multiple Tranches) since you first started lending to this Lending Strategy. To view a breakdown of your total historical interest earned across all Lending Strategies, please visit the 'My Portfolio' tab.

amountInvested.label: Lending Balance
amountInvested.tooltip: Your current USDC lending balance in this Tranche.

trancheApy.label: Tranche Gross APY
trancheApy.tooltip: The Annual Percentage Yield currently offered by the Delegate for this Tranche of this Lending Strategy, assuming all repayments will be made as expected.

yieldEarned.label: Lifetime Interest Earned
yieldEarned.tooltip: The total amount of interest you have earned (after fees) from this particular loan Tranche since you first started lending to this Tranche. To view a breakdown of your total historical interest earned across all Tranches and Lending Strategies, please visit the 'My Portfolio' tab.

lockingStatus.title: Your KSU Status
lockingStatus.subtitle: KSU Loyalty Status
lockingStatus.subtitle-2: Bonuses & Rewards – Related to this Lending Strategy Only​

lendingAndBonus.label: Lending Bonuses & Rewards
lendingAndBonus.caption: Related to This Lending Strategy Only

lockedInfo.label: Total KSU Locked
lockedInfo.tooltip: Your amount of KSU currently locked.

apyBonus.label: APY Bonus
apyBonus.tooltip: Your APY bonus (paid in KSU) in addition to the APY associated with your current USDC lending balances, which is only applicable to Loyalty Level 1 and 2 KSU Token Lockers. Loyalty Level 2 Token Lockers receive a higher APY bonus than Loyalty Level 1. The APY bonus is variable and will change from time to time to meet liquidity demand and supply requirements.​ There are no fees deducted from your APY bonus.​ There are no fees deducted from your APY bonus.

totalBonusYield.label: Total Bonus Interest Earnings
totalBonusYield.tooltip: Your current bonus interest earnings balance (paid in KSU) in addition to the interest earnings associated with your USDC lending in this Lending Strategy, whilst you have an active balance in this Lending Strategy. For example, if you withdraw your total lending from this Lending Strategy (and are therefore no longer active in this Lending Strategy), then your total bonus interest earnings will be reset to zero. To view a breakdown of your total historical bonus interest earnings across all Lending Strategies, please visit on the 'My Portfolio' tab.

lifeTimeBonus.label: Lifetime Bonus Interest Earnings
lifeTimeBonus.tooltip: The total amount of bonus interest earnings you have accumulated from this Lending Strategy since the very first time you achieved (and maintained) Loyalty Level 1 or 2.

allOtherRewards.label: Visit KSU Locking to view all your Bonuses & Rewards related to all other Lending Strategies​

transactionsHistory.title: My Transactions
transactionsHistory.tooltip: The status of your lending requests and lending withdrawal requests to and from this Lending Strategy.

reallocated.label: Reallocated
reallocated.tooltip: Reallocated to the next available Tranche due to oversubscription of lending requests to the Tranche you originally requested. You can achieve priority access to loans by locking KSU to achieve/increase your Loyalty Level.

poolOverview.rksuBalanceToolTip: The value of your current rKSU balance, which is derived by a multiplier applied to your amount of locked KSU. This multiplier varies according to your locking period, per the below table. The value of your rKSU balance relative to your total current and pending USDC lending across all Lending Strategies determines your Loyalty Level. Your Loyalty Level determines the extent of your token utility (lending access priority and lending withdrawal priority to and from Lending Strategies) and associated rewards (APY bonus). Regardless of your Loyalty Level, your rKSU balance relative to the total rKSU in the Kasu ecosystem, also determines your share of Protocol Fees (noting you must participate in USDC lending to be eligible for Protocol Fee sharing).

senior.title: Senior Tranche APY
senior.tooltip: The Annual Percentage Yield currently offered by the Delegate for the Senior Tranche of this Lending Strategy, assuming all repayments will be made as expected. The Senior tranche offers the lowest APY (and therefore, the lowest risk) of all tranches, as it has the highest ranking repayment priority in the event of losses. In the event of losses, if any funds are recovered, Senior tranche Lenders are therefore repaid prior to Mezzanine and Junior tranche Lenders.

mezzanine.title: Mezzanine Tranche APY
mezzanine.tooltip: The Annual Percentage Yield currently offered by the Delegate for the Mezzanine Tranche of this Lending Strategy, assuming all repayments will be made as expected. The Mezzanine tranche offers a higher APY (and therefore, higher risk) than the Senior tranche, but a lower APY (and therefore, lower risk) than the Junior tranche. In the event of losses, the Mezzanine tranche has a higher ranking repayment priority than the Junior tranche, but lower than the Senior tranche. In the event of losses, if any funds are recovered, Mezzanine tranche Lenders are therefore repaid prior to Junior tranche Lenders, but after Senior tranche Lenders.

junior.title: Junior Tranche APY
junior.tooltip: The Annual Percentage Yield currently offered by the Delegate for the Junior Tranche of this Lending Strategy, assuming all repayments will be made as expected. The Junior tranche offers the highest APY (and therefore, the highest risk) of all tranches, as it has the lowest ranking repayment priority in the event of losses. In the event of losses, if any funds are recovered, Junior tranche Lenders are therefore repaid after Senior and Mezzanine tranche Lenders. In the absence of a Mezzanine tranche, Junior tranche Lenders simply rank behind Senior Tranche Lenders.

withdraw.subtitle: Total Withdrawal Request Amount
