junior.tooltip: The current Annual Percentage Interest offered by the Delegate for the Junior Tranche within this Lending Strategy, assuming all repayments will be made as expected.

history.label: Lending History
history.tooltip: ​The total length of time the Delegate has been operating as a lending business.​

totalFunds.label: Total Loan Funds Originated
totalFunds.tooltip: Cumulative total USDC equivalent face value of all current and historical loans originated by the Delegate to end borrowers across all lending asset class, regardless of whether the loans have been made available on Kasu or not.​​​

totalLoans.label: Total Loans Originated
totalLoans.tooltip: Cumulative total number of all current and historical loans originated by the Delegate to end borrowers across all lending asset classes, regardless of whether the loans were made available on Kasu or not.​

assetClass.label: Asset Class(es)
assetClass.tooltip: All lending specialisations, types or categories in which the Delegate has a track record of expertise, regardless of the Lending Strategies the Delegate has made available on Kasu.

otherPools.label: Other KASU Lending Strategies
otherPools.tooltip: ​Other Lending Strategies that the Delegate has made available on Kasu.​

loans.label: Total Active Lending
loans.tooltip: Total USDC equivalent face value of all outstanding loans that the Delegate currently has deployed to end borrowers across all lending asset classes, regardless of whether the loans have been made available on Kasu or not.​

loss.label: Historical Loss Rate
loss.tooltip: Total unrecoverable losses expressed percentage of total loans originated by the Delegate since its inception, regardless of whether they relate to Lending Strategies made available on Kasu or not.

totalLossRate.label: Total Loss Rate
totalLossRate.tooltip: Total unrecoverable losses expressed as a percentage of total loans associated with the Delegate's history with this particular lending asset class, regardless of whether the loans have been made available on Kasu or not.​

apy.label: APY
apy.tooltip: The Annual Percentage Yield currently offered by the Delegate for this loan Tranche (in the case that there are multiple loan Tranches within this Lending Strategy). In the absence of multiple loan Tranches, then this reflects the APY offered for the entire Lending Strategy. This assumes all repayments will be made as expected.

assetClass.label: Asset Class
assetClass.tooltip: The lending specialisation, type or category adopted by the Delegate for this Lending Strategy.

exposureIndustry.label: Industry Exposure
exposureIndustry.tooltip: ​Industry and/or business category in which the Delegate's customers (end borrowers) operate.​

structureApy.label: Lending Strategy APY Structure
structureApy.tooltip: Indicates whether the APY offered by the Delegate is fixed for a specified period of time, or variable (subject to change every 4 epochs).

term.label: Lending Strategy Loan Term
term.tooltip: The duration of the Lending Strategy. 'Open Ended' has no fixed term or duration and is considered ongoing. A fixed term or duration has an end date, at which time it is intended that the Lending Strategy will reach maturity and all Lenders will be fully repaid (assumes all repayments will be made as expected).

loan.label: Loan Structure (End Borrowers)
loan.tooltip-1: The structure of each loan provided by the Delegate to its customers (end borrowers) with regard to maturity date and repayment profile to suit the lending asset class related to this Lending Strategy.

list.list-0: A Revolving Loan refers to a loan structure that has no defined end date as it is typically utilised to fund ongoing operations (akin to a Line of Credit, Working Capital Loan or Evergreen Facility).
list.list-1: An Amortising Term Loan refers to a loan structure that has defined Principal and Interest repayment periods until it is fully repaid upon a specific end/maturity date, as it is typically utilised to fund core debt, capital expenditure and long term projects.
list.list-2: An Interest Only Term Loan refers to a loan structure that has no principal repayments until a specific end/maturity date, as it is typically utilised to fund projects that have a defined exit period, at which time, the loan is fully repaid with the exit proceeds (or progressively repaid in line with asset sales, such as a residential apartment development).

valueLocked.label: Total Value Locked (TVL)
valueLocked.tooltip: Total USDC funds deployed by Lenders to this Lending Strategy, plus first loss capital (if contributed by the Delegate).

management.label: Total Active Lending
management.tooltip: Total USDC equivalent face value of all outstanding loans that the Delegate currently has deployed to end borrowers from this Lending Strategy.​

yield.label: Total Interest Earned
yield.tooltip: Cumulative total gross interest earned by Lenders from this Lending Strategy since its inception on the Kasu protocol, prior to Kasu protocol fees being deducted.​

activeLoans.label: Active Loans
activeLoans.tooltip: Total number of all current outstanding loans that the Delegate currently has deployed to end borrowers from this Lending Strategy.

capacity.label: Remaining Capacity
capacity.tooltip: Amount of additional USDC the Delegate is able to accept for this Lending Strategy, also represented as a percentage of the maximum Lending Strategy target USDC amount.​

firstLoss.label: First Loss Capital
firstLoss.tooltip: The amount of capital contributed by the Delegate that will be absorbed first in the event of any losses, prior to losses being absorbed by Lenders, thereby providing a degree of loss protection to Lenders.​ First Loss Capital cannot be deployed into loans.

lossRate.label: Lending Strategy Loss Rate
lossRate.tooltip: Total unrecoverable losses expressed as a percentage of total loans associated with this Lending Strategy.

guarantees.label: Guarantees
guarantees.tooltip: A legal undertaking over a Company, Trust or Director placing liability upon that particular party to repay the loan provided by the Delegate to its customer (end borrower) in the case that it cannot repay its debt.

bankControl.label: Control over Bank Accounts
bankControl.tooltip: Whether the Delegate has control over any of its customers' (end borrowers) bank accounts which derive cash revenues, providing the immediate right to these cash revenues to repay loans prior to the customer (end borrower) having access to these funds.

yearsBusiness.label: Minimum 3 years in Business
yearsBusiness.tooltip: A condition which requires a Delegate's customers (end borrowers) to prove that it has been operating for at least 3 years with adequate financial reporting history.

propertyOwners.label: Director(s)/Beneficial Owner(s) must be property owners
propertyOwners.tooltip: A condition enforced by the Delegate which requires at least one Director (or beneficial owner) for every customer (end borrower) to be a property owner with sufficient equity. The purpose of this condition is to confirm a minimum level of wealth in order to provide comfort in the event that a Director (or beneficial owner) may become personally liable for its business loan(s) where recovery action may be required.

repayments.title: Repayments and Funds Flow
repayments.loanModelDescription: The Delegate's lending model is to facilitate Fiat currency loans to real world businesses off-chain. The Asset Class and Loan Structure outlined in the 'Lending Strategy Details' screen indicates that these loans are 'Revolving/Evergreen' Loan Facilities, with fluctuating loan balances, being a function of ongoing and simultaneous loan repayments and loan redraws in Fiat currency off-chain. Accordingly, these Fiat currency transactions can only be viewed via CSV download at this current point in time.
repayments.borrowerFundsCSV: Download CSV to view fiat currency funds flow on a per borrower basis:

aggregated.title: Aggregated Funds Flow
aggregated.description: An aggregated view of this funds flow for all end borrowers, along with other/related loan funds flow is as follows. Note, this is update upon the commencement of every Epoch (clearing period).

totalBorrowers.label: Total End Borrowers (Current)
totalBorrowers.tooltip: The number of individual businesses that the Delegate is currently lending to.

Closing Loans Balance.label: Closing Loans Balance
Closing Loans Balance.tooltip: Total combined USD equivalent loan balance of all loan Tranches within this Lending Strategy, representing funds deployed into loans to end borrowers (outstanding loans) upon the closure of the most recent epoch. The closing loans balance is the net effect of the below funds flows and related transactions and will be updated every epoch.

Opening Loans Balance.label: Opening Loans Balance
Opening Loans Balance.tooltip: Total USD equivalent loan balance of all loan Tranches within this Lending Strategy, representing funds deployed into loans to end borrowers (outstanding loans) upon the closure of the prior epoch, being the same as the start of the current epoch.

Loans Drawn.label: Loans Drawn
Loans Drawn.tooltip: The USD equivalent amount within this Lending Strategy of all additional loans drawn (deployed) to end borrowers during the most recent epoch (upon closure of the most recent epoch).

Interest Accrued.label: Interest Accrued
Interest Accrued.tooltip: The USD equivalent amount within this Lending Strategy of total interest accrued by end borrowers during the most recent epoch (upon closure of the most recent epoch).

Interest Payments.label: Interest Payments
Interest Payments.tooltip: The USD equivalent amount within this Lending Strategy of total actual interest paid by end borrowers during the most recent epoch (upon closure of the most recent epoch).

Principal Repayments.label: Principal Repayments
Principal Repayments.tooltip: The USD equivalent amount within this Lending Strategy of total loan principal repayments made by end borrowers during the most recent epoch (upon closure of the most recent epoch).

Unrealised Losses.label: Unrealised Losses
Unrealised Losses.tooltip: The USD equivalent amount of loans within this Lending Strategy that became subject to formal recovery or legal action during the most recent epoch (upon closure of the most recent epoch).

Net Inflows/(Outflows).label: Net Inflows/(Outflows)
Net Inflows/(Outflows).tooltip: The upcoming/expected USD equivalent net effect of the below funds flows for the current epoch (expected upon closure of the current epoch).

Net Lending/(Lending Withdrawals).label: Net Lending/(Lending Withdrawals)
Net Lending/(Lending Withdrawals).tooltip: The total, cumulative net effect of USDC lending settled and lending withdrawals settled to and from this Lending Strategy since its inception, upon the closure of the most recent epoch.

Cumulative Lending.label: Cumulative Lending
Cumulative Lending.tooltip: Total, cumulative USDC lending settled to this Lending Strategy since its inception, upon the closure of the most recent epoch.

Cumulative Lending Withdrawals.label: Cumulative Lending Withdrawals
Cumulative Lending Withdrawals.tooltip: Total, cumulative USDC lending withdrawals settled from this Lending Strategy since its inception, upon the closure of the most recent epoch.

Net Lending/(Withdrawal Requests).label: Net Lending/(Withdrawal Requests)
Net Lending/(Withdrawal Requests).tooltip: The net effect of all current USDC lending requests and lending withdrawal requests that remain queued for this Lending Strategy for the current epoch.

Current Lending Requests.label: Current Lending Requests
Current Lending Requests.tooltip: Total of all current USDC lending requests that remain queued for this Lending Strategy for the current epoch.

Current Lending Withdrawal Requests.label: Current Lending Withdrawal Requests
Current Lending Withdrawal Requests.tooltip: Total of all current USDC lending withdrawal requests that remain queued for this Lending Strategy for the current epoch.

cumulativeFunds.title: Cumulative Lending Funds Flow - End Borrowers

upcomingFunds.title: Upcoming Lending Funds Flow - End Borrowers​

summary.metric-1-tooltip: Total Combined USDC funds deployed by Lenders across all Lending Strategies, plus the current value of all KSU locked in the Kasu protocol.
summary.metric-2-tooltip: Combined USDC equivalent face value of all loans across all Lending Strategies on Kasu that Delegates currently have deployed to end borrowers.
summary.metric-3-tooltip: Cumulative total USDC equivalent face value of all current and historical loans originated by Delegates to end borrowers from all Lending Strategies on the Kasu protocol.
summary.metric-4-tooltip: Cumulative total gross interest earned by Lenders from all loans since the inception of the Kasu protocol.
summary.metric-5-tooltip: Total unrecoverable losses expressed as a percentage of total loans associated with all Lending Strategies on the Kasu protocol.

totalKsuLocked.title: Total KSU Locked
totalKsuLocked.tooltip: Your balance of KSU currently locked.

lendingPoolInvestment.title: Total Lending Balance
lendingPoolInvestment.tooltip: Total amount of USDC lending you currently have deployed across all loans.

weightedApy.title: Weighted Average APY
weightedApy.tooltip: The average APY you are currently earning across all loans, adjusted to reflect your weighted contribution to each individual loan relative to your total contribution across all loans.

yieldEarnings.title: Lifetime Interest Earnings
yieldEarnings.tooltip: The total amount of interest you have earned since the beginning of your lending activities on Kasu.

ksuBonusRewards.title: Lifetime KSU Bonuses & Rewards
ksuBonusRewards.tooltip: The total amount of KSU earned (and estimated USDC equivalent value) since you very first locked KSU associated with: 1) APY Bonus (only applicable to Loyalty Level 1 and 2 KSU Token Lockers); and, 2) KSU Launch Bonus (only applicable for early Token Lockers until the KSU bonus pool (5% of total supply) is fully consumed, which is based on the amount and duration of KSU locked and the associated multiplier).

protocolFeesEarned.title: Lifetime Protocol Fees Earned
protocolFeesEarned.tooltip: Your share of USDC Protocol Fees earned (claimed and unclaimed) since you very first locked KSU and participated in USDC lending on Kasu. A Token Locker must also participate in USDC lending and generate rKSU to be eligible for Protocol Fee Sharing. Token Lockers, who are also Lenders generating rKSU, are entitled to a share of 5% of the total gross interest earnings generated by lending activities on Kasu. Your proportionate share of this amount is determined by your rKSU balance relative to the total combined rKSU balance of all Lenders in the Kasu ecosystem. For example, in a scenario where a total of 1,000 rKSU from Lenders exists in the entire Kasu ecosystem, a Lender with a current balance of 150 rKSU (which is 15%) would be entitled to 15% of all Protocol Fees. This proportionality is augmented as more Lenders lock (or unlock) KSU to generate more rKSU (or burn more rKSU when unlocking), entitling them to a proportionate share of Protocol Fees.

lendingRequests.title: Lending Requests
lendingRequests.metric-1-tooltip-1: The total USDC amount of Lending Requests you have submitted across all Lending Strategies.
lendingRequests.metric-1-tooltip-2: If a Lending Request is submitted prior to the commencement of the clearing period of the current epoch (which occurs at the end of each epoch), then the Delegate will accept/reject the Lending Request in full by the end of this epoch. Otherwise, a Lending Request will remain queued (‘Requested’ status) until the next clearing period (to be Accepted/Rejected at the end of the next epoch). Similarly, if a Lending Request is submitted during the clearing period of the current epoch, it will also remain queued until the next epoch.
lendingRequests.metric-2-tooltip-1: The total USDC amount of Lending Requests that has been accepted by the Delegate(s) across all Lending Strategies.
lendingRequests.metric-2-tooltip-2: If a Lending Request is submitted prior to the commencement of the clearing period of the current epoch (which occurs at the end of each epoch), then the Delegate will accept/reject the Lending Requests in full by the end of this epoch. Otherwise, a Lending Request will remain queued (‘Requested’ status) until the next clearing period (to be Accepted/Rejected at the end of the next epoch). Similarly, if a Lending Request is submitted during the clearing period of the current epoch, it will also remain queued until the next epoch.
lendingRequests.metric-3-tooltip-1: The total USDC amount of Lending Requests that has been rejected by the Delegate(s) across all Lending Strategies, due to lack of end borrower demand, or excess liquidity.
lendingRequests.metric-3-tooltip-2: If a Lending Request is submitted prior to the commencement of the clearing period of the current epoch (which occurs at the end of each epoch), then the Delegate will accept/reject the Lending Requests in full by the end of this epoch. Otherwise, a Lending Request will remain queued (‘Requested’ status)  until the next clearing period (to be Accepted/Rejected at the end of the next epoch). Similarly, if a Lending Request is submitted during the clearing period of the current epoch, it will also remain queued until the next epoch.
lendingRequests.metric-4-tooltip-1: The total USDC amount of accepted Lending Requests that has been reallocated out from your initial requested Tranche(s) to the next available Tranche(s), due to the initial requested Tranche(s) being oversubscribed (full).​
lendingRequests.metric-4-tooltip-3: you acknowledged during the Loan Contract Acceptance process for more details.​

subsequentTransactions.title: Subsequent Transactions
subsequentTransactions.subtitle: (Post Acceptance)
subsequentTransactions.metric-1-tooltip: The total USDC amount returned to you by the Delegate(s), due to lack of demand for funding from end borrowers.
subsequentTransactions.metric-2-tooltip-1: The total USDC amount currently awaiting your instructions for the Delegate to either deploy to end borrowers, or return your funds to you instead.
subsequentTransactions.metric-2-tooltip-2: As per your acknowledgement in the
subsequentTransactions.metric-2-tooltip-3: if you do not provide any ‘Opt In/Out’ instructions within 48 hours of receiving an email requesting your decision, then you will be deemed to have automatically opted in (otherwise known as ‘negative consent’).
subsequentTransactions.metric-3-tooltip-1: The total USDC amount that you have ‘Opted In’ for the Delegate to deploy to end borrowers.
subsequentTransactions.metric-3-tooltip-2: As per your acknowledgement in the
subsequentTransactions.metric-3-tooltip-3: if you did not provide any ‘Opt In/Out’ instructions within 48 hours of receiving an email requesting your decision, then you are deemed to have automatically opted in (otherwise known as ‘negative consent’).
subsequentTransactions.metric-4-tooltip-1: The total USDC amount that you have ‘Opted Out’ from the Delegate deploying to end borrowers, where funds will be returned to you instead.
subsequentTransactions.metric-4-tooltip-3: for further details as to how the ‘Opt In/Out’ process works.

withdrawalRequests.title: Withdrawal Requests
withdrawalRequests.metric-1-tooltip-1: If a Withdrawal Request is submitted prior to the commencement of the clearing period of the current epoch (which occurs at the end of each epoch), then the Delegate will process the Withdrawal Request by the end of this epoch, by submitting it to a queue to accept nil, part, or all of the Request . Otherwise, a Withdrawal Request will not be submitted to the queue until the next clearing period (end of the next epoch). Similarly, if a Withdrawal Request is submitted during the clearing period of the current epoch, it will also not be submitted to the queue until the next epoch.
withdrawalRequests.metric-1-tooltip-2: As per your acknowledgement in the
withdrawalRequests.metric-1-tooltip-3: the processing of your Withdrawal Requests is contingent upon the excess liquidity within each specific Lending Strategy, and may therefore remain outstanding (or partially outstanding) for one or more epochs.
withdrawalRequests.metric-2-tooltip-1: The current USDC amount of Withdrawal Requests you have submitted across all Lending Strategies that remains queued (where a Delegate will accept nil, part, of all of the Request). The Delegate will continually accept nil, part, or all of the Withdrawal Requests at the end of each epoch, until the funds are fully returned to the Lender (assuming no losses or defaults by end borrowers).
withdrawalRequests.metric-2-tooltip-2: Should any amount(s) of your Withdrawal Request(s)  remain queued for more than five epochs, they will automatically be prioritised above all Loyalty Levels.​
withdrawalRequests.metric-2-tooltip-3: As per your acknowledgement in the
withdrawalRequests.metric-2-tooltip-4: the acceptance of Withdrawal Requests is contingent upon the excess liquidity within each specific Lending Strategy, and may therefore remain outstanding (or partially outstanding) for one or more epochs.
withdrawalRequests.metric-3-tooltip-1: The total USDC amount of Withdrawal Requests that has been accepted (in part or full) by the Delegate(s) across all Lending Strategies.​
withdrawalRequests.metric-3-tooltip-2: The Delegate will continually accept nil, part, or all of the Withdrawal Requests at the end of each epoch until funds are fully returned to the Lender (assuming no losses or defaults by end borrowers).

reallocation.tooltip-1: Funds received into this tranche are a result of your initial requested tranche being oversubscribed (full). In such a case, funds are reallocated to the next available tranche.​
reallocation.tooltip-3: you acknowledged during the Loan Contract Acceptance process for more details.

reallocatedOut.tooltip-1: The portion of this single accepted Lending Request that has been reallocated out from this initial requested tranche to the next available Tranche, due to this initial requested Tranche being oversubscribed (full).
reallocatedOut.tooltip-3: you acknowledged during the Loan Contract Acceptance process for more details.

reallocatedIn.tooltip-1: The portion of accepted Lending Requests associated with another tranche that has been reallocated to this next available tranche, due to your initial requested tranche(s) being oversubscribed (full).
reallocatedIn.tooltip-3: you acknowledged during the Loan Contract Acceptance process for more details.

fundsReturned.tooltip-1: Funds will be returned to you by the Delegate due to lack of demand for funding from end borrowers, or the Delegate’s being unable to identify a suitable end borrower.
fundsReturned.tooltip-2: The USDC amount of a single Lending Request that was previously accepted, but will now be returned to you by the Delegate due to lack of demand for funding from end borrowers, or the Delegate being unable to identify a suitable end borrower.

requested.tooltip-1: The USDC amount of this single Lending request.
requested.tooltip-2: If a Lending Request is submitted prior to the commencement of the learing period of the current epoch (which occurs at the end of each poch), then the Delegate will accept/reject the Lending Request in full y the end of this epoch. Otherwise, a Lending Request will remain queued ‘Requested’ status) until the next clearing period (to be ccepted/Rejected at the end of the next epoch). Similarly, if a Lending equest is submitted during the clearing period of the current epoch, it ill also remain queued until the next epoch.

accepted.tooltip-1: The portion of the single Lending Request that has been accepted by the Delegate.
accepted.tooltip-2: If a Lending Request is submitted prior to the commencement of the clearing period of the current epoch (which occurs at the end of each epoch), then the Delegate will accept/reject the Lending Requests in full by the end of this epoch. Otherwise, a Lending Request will remain queued (‘Requested’ status) until the next clearing period (to be Accepted/Rejected at the end of the next epoch). Similarly, if a Lending Request is submitted during the clearing period of the current epoch, it will also remain queued until the next epoch.

rejected.tooltip-1: The portion of the single Lending Request that has been rejected by the Delegate, due to factors such as lack of end borrower demand or excess liquidity within this Lending Strategy.
rejected.tooltip-2: If a Lending Request is submitted prior to the commencement of the clearing period of the current epoch (which occurs at the end of each epoch), then the Delegate will accept/reject the Lending Request in full by the end of this epoch. Otherwise, a Lending Request will remain queued (‘Requested’ status) until the next clearing period (to be Accepted/Rejected at the end of the next epoch). Similarly, if a Lending Request is submitted during the clearing period of the current epoch, it will also remain queued until the next epoch.

requested.tooltip-1: The USDC amount of this single Withdrawal Request.
requested.tooltip-2: If a Withdrawal Request is submitted prior to the commencement of the clearing period of the current epoch (which occurs at the end of each epoch), then the Delegate will process the Withdrawal Request by the end of this epoch, by submitting it to a queue to accept nil, part, or all of the Request . Otherwise, a Withdrawal Request will not be submitted to the queue until the next clearing period (end of the next epoch). Similarly, if a Withdrawal Request is submitted during the clearing period of the current epoch, it will also not be submitted to the queue until the next epoch.
requested.tooltip-3: As per your acknowledgement in the
requested.tooltip-4: the processing of your Withdrawal Requests is contingent upon the excess liquidity within each specific Lending Strategy, and may therefore remain outstanding (or partially outstanding) for one or more epochs.

accepted.tooltip-1: The portion of the single Withdrawal Requests that has been accepted (in part or full) by the Delegate.
accepted.tooltip-2: If a Lending Request is submitted prior to the commencement of the clearing period of the current epoch (which occurs at the end of each epoch), then the Delegate will accept/reject the Lending Requests in full by the end of this epoch. Otherwise, a Lending Request will remain queued (‘Requested’ status) until the next clearing period (to be Accepted/Rejected at the end of the next epoch). Similarly, if a Lending Request is submitted during the clearing period of the current epoch, it will also remain queued until the next epoch.

queued.tooltip-1: The portion of the single Withdrawal Requests that remains queued (where a Delegate will accept nil, part, of all of the Request). The Delegate will continually accept nil, part, or all of the Withdrawal Requests at the end of each epoch, until the funds are fully returned to the Lender (assuming no losses or defaults by end borrowers).
queued.tooltip-2: Should any amount(s) of your Withdrawal Request(s) remain queued for more than five epochs, they will automatically be prioritised above all Loyalty Levels.
queued.tooltip-3: As per your acknowledgement in the
queued.tooltip-4: the acceptance of Withdrawal Requests is contingent upon the excess liquidity within each specific Lending Strategy, and may therefore remain outstanding (or partially outstanding) for one or more epochs.

wallet.title: My Wallet
wallet.metric-1-tooltip: The individual balances of all your cryptocurrencies in your connected Web3 wallet that can be instantly converted to KSU.
wallet.metric-2-tooltip: Your current KSU balance (and estimated USDC equivalent value) held in your Web3 wallet.
wallet.metric-3-toolip: Total USDC equivalent value of all tokens in your Web3 wallet that can be used to purchase KSU tokens.
